name: Creative Visual Storytelling in Film Production

prereqs.text: (76-101 [] at least D) or (76-102 [] at least D) or ((76-106 [] at least D) and (76-107 [] at least D)) or ((76-106 [] at least D) and (76-108 [] at least D)) or ((76-107 [] at least D) and (76-108 [] at least D))

long_desc: Visual storytelling cuts to the heart of the filmmaking process, combining all elements of the craft to engage the viewer.  Every picture is comprised of a story, visuals, and, sometimes, sounds.  This class is about learning how to understand and control timebased images to better tell your story.  We will learn essential skills for becoming a creative technological storyteller  how to think visually and aurally.  Fundamental focus will be on understanding the basic visual components using space, tone, line, shape, color, movement and rhythm and how they are used to visually tell a story, define characters, communicate moods, emotions, thoughts and ideas.  We often are not consciously aware of them within a film but are critical in establishing the relationship between story structure and visual structure.  Through readings, film analysis, creative brainstorming, assignments and individual critiques this class will guide each student into translating their creative vision into a short final film.

custom_fields.key_topics: Filmmaking. Story Structure. Visual Structure. Interactive Narrative. Interactive Documentaries. Visual Components.
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
Students will work either individually or in teams to write, produce, shoot and edit several visual story assignments.

Each assignment is designed to actualize key components in the creative and production process. By the end of the semester the students will have completed a final video for presentation.
custom_fields.relevance: This course is part of the FIlm Major in the English Department.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Lectures, web pages, case studies, handouts and guest filmmakers will be used during the course of the semester
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Yes, students will be required to work on some assignments outside of class as well their final video productions.
